snippet: South Korea welcomed a surprise overture from the North, suggesting a possible thaw in relations that have been deeply hostile in recent months.
abstract: North Korea and South Korea agree to first government dialogue in years, abrupt change after tensions over escalation of North Korea's nuclear program; announcement raises hopes the two countries are moving toward a thaw in relations after a prolonged standoff that included military provocations from North Korea and retaliatory economic penalties from South Korea.

byline.contributor: Mark Landler contributed reporting from Washington.

lead_paragraph: South Korea welcomed a surprise overture from the North, suggesting a possible thaw in relations that have been deeply hostile in recent months.

headline.seo: North and South Korea Agree to Dialogue
headline.main: North and South Korea Agree to First Official Dialogue in Years
headline.print_headline: North and South Korea Agree to First Official Dialogue in Years
